skill: Place a unit fraction on 0-1 number line by counting intervals from zero
problem_type: Student places unit fraction on pre-partitioned 0-1 number line either by using points or by dragging labels
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 1 with tick marks pre-placed at all fraction positions for the given denominator. Only 0 and 1 are labeled.
prompt_examples: Place one-third on the number line.
Place the label on the number line.
Place a point at 1/3.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point at the correct position
correct_end_state: Point appears at the correct position
success_dialogue: That's right, one-third. One interval from zero.
Yes, that's one-fourth.
Correct, that's where one-fifth goes.

skill: Place a unit fraction on 0-1 number line by counting intervals from zero
problem_type: Student places unit fractions with scaffolded language hints either by dragging labels or placing points on the number line.
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 1 with tick marks pre-placed at all fraction positions for the given denominator. Only 0 and 1 are labeled.
prompt_examples: Place one-half on the number line. One interval from zero.
Label 1/4 on the number line. One interval from zero.
Place one-fourth. One interval from zero.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point at the correct position
correct_end_state: Point appears at the correct position
success_dialogue: You found it! One space from zero.
That's right, one-half is one interval from zero.
Good. One-third is one space from zero.

skill: Place a non-unit fraction on 0-1 number line by counting intervals from zero
problem_type: Student places non-unit fraction on pre-partitioned 0-1 number line
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 1 with tick marks pre-placed at all fraction positions for the given denominator. Only 0 and 1 are labeled.
prompt_examples: Place three-fourths on the number line.
Place a point where two-thirds goes.
Place a point at 3/8.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point at the target non-unit fraction by counting numerator intervals from zero
correct_end_state: Point appears at the correct position; fraction label appears
success_dialogue: That's three-fourths, three intervals from zero.
Right, that's 2/3.
Correct, 3/5 is the third fifth from zero.

skill: Place a non-unit fraction on 0-1 number line by counting intervals from zero
problem_type: Student places non-unit fraction with scaffolded hints
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 1 with tick marks pre-placed at all fraction positions for the given denominator. Only 0 and 1 are labeled.
prompt_examples: Place three-fourths, three intervals from zero.
Place a point at 2/3 on the number line. That's two spaces.
Place a point where 3/4 goes. Count the intervals: 1/4, 2/4, 3/4.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point after counting highlighted intervals
correct_end_state: Point appears at the correct position; label appears
success_dialogue: That's three-fourths, three intervals from zero.
Right, that's 2/3.
Correct, 3/5 is the third fifth from zero.

skill: Place fractions beyond 1 on extended number line
problem_type: Student places fraction beyond 1 on extended 0-2 number line
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 2 with tick marks pre-placed. Labels ONLY at 0, 1, and 2.
prompt_examples: Place five-fourths on the number line.
Locate 5/4 on the number line.
Place a point where seven-fourths goes.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point at the position beyond 1 that represents the target fraction
correct_end_state: Point appears at the correct position; fraction label appears
success_dialogue: Yes, that's five-fourths, one interval past 1.
Good. That's 6/4, two fourths past 1.
Right, seven-fourths is seven intervals from 0.

skill: Place fractions beyond 1 on extended number line
problem_type: Student places fraction beyond 1 with scaffolded SUPPORT
prompt_examples: Place five-fourths, count five intervals from zero.
5/4 is one more than 4/4. Place a point where it goes.
Place five-fourths. Count five spaces from zero.
action_description: Student drags the label or places a point one space after the 1 position
correct_end_state: Point appears at 5/4 position; label appears
success_dialogue: Good, you correctly selected five-fourths!
Correct, that's 3/2. Halfway between 1 and 2.
Nice, you placed four-thirds on the number line.

skill: Identify the denominator of fractions on a number line by counting intervals
problem_type: Student counts intervals on number line to identify the denominator (MCQ)
workspace_description: Number line from 0 to 1 with tick marks pre-placed. MCQ options appear below with adjacent numbers (e.g., 3, 4, 5).
prompt_examples: What would be the denominator of a fraction on this number line?
Count the intervals between 0 and 1. How many are there?
Look at this number line. How many spaces from 0 to 1?
action_description: Student selects the number that represents the count of intervals from the options
correct_end_state: Selected answer highlighted as correct; intervals may flash to confirm
success_dialogue: Yes, four spaces means fourths.
Right, you counted three intervals.
Correct. Six equal intervals show sixths.

skill: Identify the fraction represented by a point on 0-1 number line
problem_type: Student identifies the fraction represented by a point already placed on 0-1 number line (MCQ)
workspace_description: Number line 0-1 with a point already placed at a fraction position. Labels only at 0 and 1. MCQ options show possible fractions.
prompt_examples: What fraction does this point show?
Look at where the point is. What fraction is that?
Name the fraction at this position.
action_description: Student selects the matching fraction from the options or drags the correct fraction to the point
correct_end_state: Selected answer highlighted; fraction label appears at point
success_dialogue: Yes, that's two-thirds. Two spaces from zero.
That's right, 3/4 is three fourths from zero.
Right, you correctly selected one-fifth.

skill: Identify fractions beyond 1 on extended number line
problem_type: Student identifies the fraction represented by a point placed beyond 1 (MCQ)
workspace_description: Number line 0-2 with a point placed beyond 1. MCQ options show beyond-1 fractions.
prompt_examples: What fraction does this point show?
Look at where the point is. What fraction is that?
Name the fraction at this position.
action_description: Student selects the matching fraction from the options or drags the correct fraction to the point
correct_end_state: Selected answer highlighted; fraction label appears at point
success_dialogue: Yes, that's two-thirds. Two spaces from zero.
That's right, 3/4 is three fourths from zero.
Right, you correctly selected one-fifth.

skill: Compare and select number lines partitioned into specific fraction types
problem_type: Student selects which number line shows a specific fraction type (comparison)
workspace_description: Three, (not 2 or 4, only THREE) number lines (0-1) shown vertically stacked, each with different interval counts. Student selects the one matching the target.
prompt_examples: Which number line shows fourths?
Find the line divided into thirds.
One of these shows fifths. Which one?
action_description: Student selects the the line with a target count
success_dialogue: That one—four equal spaces for fourths.
Right. Three equal intervals means thirds.
Correct! You found the line with fifths.

skill: Compare fractions by examining their positions on number lines
problem_type: Student compares 2-3 points on different number lines to identify which is larger.
workspace_description: 2-3 number lines (labelled at 0 and 1) partitioned into same number of intervals with a point placed on each line at different fraction positions for comparison. The point should be labelled with the appropriate fraction.
prompt_examples: Which point shows the larger fraction?
Look at the two points. Which is farther from 0?
Which fraction is greater distance from 0?
action_description: Student selects the number line with a point at the larger fraction.
success_dialogue: Yes three-fourths, further from zero means more.
Right. More spaces from zero show larger fraction.
Correct, four-fifths is greater. You can see it's further from 0.

skill: Apply fraction understanding to real-world scenarios involving fractions beyond 1
problem_type: Student identifies fraction in context describing something beyond 1 (application)
workspace_description: Number line from 0-2, labelled at 0, 1 and 2.
prompt_examples: Sam walked 5 spaces on a fourths number line starting at 0. What fraction did Sam reach?
A frog jumped 6 equal fourths from 0. Where did it land?
Hannah ran a loop and a third of another loop. Show her progress as a point on a number line.
The recipe asks for three halves of a chocolate bar. Show it on the number line.
action_description: Student places a point at the appropriate fraction tick on the number line.
success_dialogue: Five spaces from zero—five-fourths.
Right! Six intervals means 6/4.
Seven-fourths. Past one whole.

skill: Identify number lines with equal versus unequal intervals
problem_type: Student identifies equal vs unequal intervals (identify)
workspace_description: Three number lines (0-1) vertically stacked, one of the number lines shows correct number of equal intervals (four equal intervals for fourths, three equal intervals for thirds and so on), one shows incorrect number of equal intervals (if question is asking for fifths, 4 or 6 equal intervals) and one shows correct number of unequal intervals (if question is asking for fifths, 5 unequal intervals.).
prompt_examples: Select the number line that shows fourths.
One of the lines is partitioned into thirds. Select this line.
action_description: Student identifies the line with correct number of equal intervals (for fourths, 4. for fifths, 5) and selects it.
success_dialogue: Yes, this line has four equal intervals.
Right! Three equal intervals for thirds.
